net.metarelate.terminology.coreModel
Interface LabelManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
LabelManagerTDBImpl
public interface LabelManager

The label manager handles label that are part of a global label pool that can be accessed by the system to render URIs with their label. Labels that defined within registers are not seen by the LabelManager.

Author:
andrea_splendiani

URI_IF_NULL

static final int URI_IF_NULL
Specifies to return the URI of a resource if no label is found

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UNDEF_IF_NULL

static final int UNDEF_IF_NULL
Specifies to return the undefined string uk.gov.metoffice.terminology.config.CoreConfig#UNDEFINED_LABEL if no label is found.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LANG_DEF_SHORTURI

static final int LANG_DEF_SHORTURI
If no label for the specified label is found, look for the a label in the default language. If no label is found, look for a label without language specification. If nothings is found returns the local part of the URI as a label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LANG_DEF_NULL

static final int LANG_DEF_NULL
If no label for the specified label is found, look for the a label in the default language. If no label is found, look for a label without language specification. If nothings is found returns null.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LANG_DEF_URI

static final int LANG_DEF_URI
If no label for the specified label is found, look for the a label in the default language. If no label is found, look for a label without language specification. If nothings is found returns the URI.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getLabelForURI

java.lang.String getLabelForURI(java.lang.String uri,
                                int method)
Returns a label for a URI, following the method specified. Note that a random label matching the requirements is returned.

Parameters:
uri -
method - what to do if no label matching the criteria is found

getLabelForURI

java.lang.String getLabelForURI(java.lang.String uri,
                                java.lang.String language,
                                int method)
Returns a label for a URI, for a given language and following the method specified. Note that a random label matching the requirements is returned.

Parameters:
uri -
language - specified as in the RDF representation
method - what to do if no label matching the criteria is found

getLanguagesForURI

java.lang.String[] getLanguagesForURI(java.lang.String uri)
Returns the list of languages in which labels for the given uri are available. TODO this is currently unimplemented and returns null.

Parameters:
uri -
Returns:

registerLabels

void registerLabels(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Model labelsModel)
Record a set of labels to uri association.

Parameters:
labelsModel - a Jena Model containing a set of statements like uri rdfs:label label TODO other types of statements maybe be included in the label manager (not an error, but not a design choice)
